item.title: Ask Us Anything During JetBrains AMA Week
item.description: JetBrains will be hosting a series of open Ask Me Anything (AMA) sessions on Reddit December 9‚Äì12. On scheduled days, our product teams will join r/jetbrains to talk directly with developers who use our tools every day. item.title: 5 Stories Of Developers Using JetBrains Rider to Create, Collaborate, and Have Fun
item.description: A year ago, we introduced a free non-commercial use license option for JetBrains Rider, hoping to remove barriers for developers who code with no financial objective in mind for their projects. item.title: Grok Models Come to the AI Chat in JetBrains IDEs

item.description: DataGrip 2025.3, the final major update of the year, is here! Let‚Äôs take a look at what it has to offer. item.title: dotInsights | December 2025
item.description: Did you know? Calling GC.Collect() explicitly forces the garbage collector to run and reclaim memory from unreachable objects. However, it‚Äôs generally discouraged to use this method in most applications because the garbage collector is highly optimized to run automatically. Forcing it can lead to performance issues by interrupting the normal optimization process. Welcome to dotInsights [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/12/02/dotinsights-december-2025/

item.title: How to Achieve Significant Build Performance Gains With TeamCity
item.description: This article is brought to you by Mdu Sibisi, draft.dev. Long build times interfere with developer momentum, disrupt flow states, and negatively impact productivity. While seemingly minor gaps in work rate may appear negligible in the moment, they quickly accumulate into significant increases in release cycle times and infrastructure costs. (There‚Äôs a reason high-performance development [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2025/12/build-performance-gains/

item.title: Cutting Through the Noise: Smarter Context Management for LLM-Powered Agents
item.description: Imagine you‚Äôre working on a project and jotting down every single idea, experiment, and failure. item.title: Solving Advent of Code in Rust, With Just Enough AI

item.title: Master Spring Data AOT in IntelliJ IDEA
item.description: Spring‚Äôs AOT engine has been around since the Spring Native days, but Spring Data never really benefited from it ‚Äì until now. Repository infrastructure is one of the most dynamic parts of the framework, and for years it relied heavily on proxies, reflection, and queries generated at runtime. That flexibility has a price: it slows [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/11/spring-data-aot/

item.title: Building AI Agents in Kotlin ‚Äì Part 2: A Deeper Dive Into Tools
item.description: In the previous article, we saw how to build a basic coding agent with list, read, write, and edit capabilities. Today, we‚Äôll dive into how to extend the agents‚Äô capabilities by creating additional tools within the Koog framework. As an example, we‚Äôll be building an ExecuteShellCommandTool, teaching our agent to run code and close the [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/building-ai-agents-in-kotlin-part-2-a-deeper-dive-into-tools/
